author: afdudley
content:
Can someone explain to me what:
https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/blob/master/EIPS/eip-1559.md#backwards-compatibility

What is this trying to say? Is it that the fees will be higher for the user submitting the transactions?

author: timbeiko
content: Not exactly: it means they don’t get a refund based on the difference between FEE CAP and  the TIP+BASE FEE

author: timbeiko
content: So they can’t set a high fee cap as a buffer: if their gas price is too high, the extra goes to the miner vs txn sender
